thread.title: Smiling Jamie Lynn Spears walks hand-in-hand with daughter Maddie as she recovers from ATV accident scars - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Smiling Jamie Lynn Spears walks hand-in-hand with daughter Maddie as she recovers from ATV accident scars - Mirror Online

author: Vicki Newman
title: Smiling Jamie Lynn Spears walks hand-in-hand with daughter Maddie as she recovers from ATV accident scars - Mirror Online
text:
Jamie Lynn Spears' performance of "When The Lights Go Out" Share this video 
She had been unconscious but reportedly came round and was talking on Tuesday. 
But Maddie now appears to be on the mend. 
Her mum posted a picture of them leaving hospital in a helicopter on Instagram to thank the hospital that helped her daughter and fans around the world who offered their love and support. 
The former Zoey 101 star wrote: "Thanks to the amazing first responders, and medical teams at University and Children's Hospital in New Orleans, LA, we are headed home with our baby girl as she continues to recover. Read More Jamie Lynn Spears' daughter Maddie smiles as she leaves hospital in a helicopter after ATV accident Jamie Lynn and Maddie left hospital in a helicopter (Photo: jamielynnspears/Instagram) 
"Above all else we are so thankful for each and every prayer, because we know that is what truly made the difference. Thank you again to everyone. We are truly blessed" 
Britney also celebrated Maddie leaving the hospital. 
She posted on Twitter: "So grateful that Maddie was able to go home today... it's truly a miracle. Our prayers were heard, and they were answered! Thank you so much for all of your love and support this week. My family appreciated it more than you will ever know." 
According to a police report, Maddie was at home in Louisiana with parents Jamie Lynn and her stepdad Jamie Watson when her ATV crashed. Jamie Lynn with Maddie and her mum Lynne Spears (Photo: FilmMagic, Inc) 
The report, obtained by People magazine, says the accident happened in full view of them. 
Just before 3pm on Sunday, Maddie was steering the ATV - which she reportedly got for her 7th birthday - in order to avoid going over a drainage ditch. 
“In doing so, she overcorrected causing the ATV to enter the pond,” the report states. “The ATV and child were instantly submerged in the water right before their eyes. 
“Within seconds the child’s mother, stepfather and other family members reached the pond, dove in and attempted to rescue the child to no avail. The child was trapped and secured by the seatbelt and the ATV’s safety netting. 
"Within two minutes, Acadian Ambulance Services arrived and assisted in freeing the child from the cold waters.” Like us on Facebook
